title: Storm-0501: Cloud-Native Ransomware Targeting Hybrid Azure Environments
affected_products: On-premises Active Directory synced to cloud

timeline.event: Storm-0501 first observed as a ransomware affiliate
Microsoft publishes first analysis of Storm-0501 hybrid cloud attacks
Microsoft Entra Connect releases modern authentication update
Microsoft publishes detailed analysis of evolved cloud-based ransomware tactics
Multiple large organizations report Storm-0501 attacks

simple_summary.what_happened: Storm-0501 is a financially motivated threat actor that has evolved from traditional on-premises ransomware to cloud-native attacks. Unlike conventional ransomware that encrypts files, Storm-0501 leverages cloud capabilities to exfiltrate data, destroy backups, and extort victims without deploying traditional malware. They compromise Active Directory, pivot to Microsoft Entra ID, and gain global administrator privileges.
simple_summary.who_is_affected: Organizations using Microsoft hybrid cloud environments are primary targets. This includes companies with on-premises Active Directory synced to Azure via Entra Connect, Microsoft 365 users, and any organization with hybrid identity configurations. Large enterprises with complex cloud deployments are particularly at risk.
simple_summary.what_attackers_do: Step 1: Storm-0501 gains initial access through known vulnerabilities (Zoho ManageEngine, Citrix NetScaler, ColdFusion). Step 2: Compromises on-premises Active Directory environment. Step 3: Identifies non-human accounts (service accounts) with Global Administrator privileges and no MFA. Step 4: Resets on-premises password and syncs to cloud identity. Step 5: Registers new MFA method to gain cloud admin access. Step 6: Assigns Owner roles across Azure subscriptions, exfiltrates data, deletes backups, and sends extortion messages via Microsoft Teams.
what_you_should_do: Enable MFA for ALL accounts, especially service accounts and Global Administrators
Enable Trusted Platform Module (TPM) on Entra Connect Sync server
Turn on tamper protection in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
Review and limit accounts with Global Administrator privileges
Monitor for suspicious password resets on privileged accounts
Implement conditional access policies to block suspicious sign-ins
Enable immutable backups that cannot be deleted by cloud admins
simple_summary.why_this_is_serious: Storm-0501 represents a fundamental shift in ransomware tactics. They don't need to deploy malware - they use your own cloud infrastructure against you. By gaining cloud admin access, they can delete all backups, exfiltrate sensitive data, and lock you out of your own systems. They've been affiliated with major ransomware operations including Embargo, ALPHV/BlackCat, Hive, and LockBit.

tactics.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in Zoho ManageEngine, Citrix NetScaler, ColdFusion
Registering new MFA methods on compromised cloud accounts
Abusing synced identities to gain Global Administrator privileges
Disabling security tools and deleting backup solutions
Using cloud-native tools to exfiltrate large volumes of data
Deleting cloud backups and data to pressure victims

detection_guidance.summary: Monitor for suspicious activity on hybrid identity accounts, especially password resets on privileged accounts followed by MFA registration from new devices or locations. Watch for unusual role assignments in Azure.

log_sources.description: Authentication events, MFA registrations, conditional access results
Password changes, role assignments, application registrations
Role assignments, resource deletions, subscription-level changes
Password resets on synced accounts, Event ID 4724/4723

what_to_look_for.indicator: Password reset on privileged synced account
what_to_look_for.description: On-premises password change on accounts synced to Entra ID with admin roles
what_to_look_for.log_field: Event ID 4724 on accounts in AAD sync scope

what_to_look_for.description: MFA registration from unexpected location after password change
what_to_look_for.log_field: Entra ID Audit: Register security info from new IP

what_to_look_for.description: Owner or Global Admin roles assigned to accounts
Deletion of Azure Backup vaults or recovery points
Messages to employees from compromised admin accounts
what_to_look_for.log_field: Teams audit logs for messages from admin accounts

immediate_actions.description: Identify all accounts with Global Admin or Owner roles, especially service accounts

immediate_actions.action: Enforce MFA on All Admin Accounts
immediate_actions.description: Ensure all privileged accounts have MFA enabled with no exceptions

immediate_actions.action: Enable TPM on Entra Connect Server
immediate_actions.description: Protect credentials stored on the synchronization server
Block sign-ins from unusual locations or devices for admin accounts
Configure Azure Backup with immutability to prevent deletion
Audit Directory Synchronization Accounts and their permissions
